title: Indigenous
common:
This list comprises families with at least one known indigenous ancestor, some of whom were later regarded as Europeans by their descendants in an attempt to avoid interracial mixing (Schneider, Alberto L., 2016, pp. 99-100) and elevate their social status.

The families in this section do not follow the pattern used in other sections and need a grammatical review.

The families can be updated at any time based on new research.

value.name: Inca (Tawantinsuyu):
value.desc: Refers to the kings of the Inca (Tawantinsuyu) Empire. While mythological and unknown rulers are mentioned, the focus is on those whose existence has been verified.

value.name: Indigenous of Piratininga:
value.desc: Individuals who lived in São Paulo, SP, during the city's early years.

value.name: Bettinck/Betting/Betim:
value.desc: Indigenous ancestry enters this family's lineage with the marriage of Gehard Bettinck to Custódia Dias.

value.name: Dias (São Vicente):
value.desc: Indigenous roots are traced back to the marriage of Lopo Dias to Beatriz Dias.

value.name: Dias (Bahia):
value.desc: Initially reported as Portuguese by Pedro Taques (de Moura, Américo, 1951, pp. 347) and Luiz G. Silva Leme (Silva Leme, Luiz G., 1904, Volume VII, pp. 03), it was refuted by Priest Serafim Leite (Projeto Compartilhar, "Pedro Dias").

value.name: Dias (Espírito Santo - Fundão):
value.desc: Indigenous individuals documented in the Jesuits' records during the 18th Century.

value.name: Fernandes:
value.desc: Indigenous ancestry is introduced through the marriage of Manuel Fernandes Ramos to Suzana Dias.

value.name: Leme:
value.desc: Indigenous roots emerge with the marriage of Fernão Dias (Paes) to Maria Leite da Silva.

value.name: Rodrigues (São Vicente/São Paulo):
value.desc: After being historically regarded as a family originating from Porto, Portugal, preliminary genetic sequencing research suggests indigenous ancestry.

value.name: Tavares (São Paulo):
value.desc: Indigenous heritage is established with the marriage of Antonio Raposo Tavares to Beatriz Bicudo.
